questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -

STARTING UP A PROJECT -
Here are three actions carried out by the project manager during the 'starting up a project' process.
As part of which activity (A-F) should each action be carried out?
Choose only one activity for each action. Each activity can be used once, more than once, or not at all.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Acceptance criteria -- > Prepare outline Business Case as this is when PPD is created. (refer 14.4.4) 
Identify training Needs --> Design & Appoint the project management team. (refer 14.4.3) 
Document needs for confidentiality --> Select the project approach and assemble the project brief as this is when security constraints are considered. (refer 14.4.5)

Confirming acceptance criteria for the project product is part of the Project Initiation Documentation (PID) in PRINCE2.
Identify training needs is part of project approach
confidential needs are part of business case.

B

Based on the search results, the true statement with regard to the responsibility for appointing the Project Manager in PRINCE2 is:

Statement B is True: The Project Board is responsible for appointing the Project Manager.

comments.content: This is not correct. It is the Executive responsibilities.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
"C". ref C.2.1 "Executive responsibilities"

questions.question_text: Who is responsible for appointing the Project Manager?

During the 'starting up a project' process, the project manager discusses the standard model for course development with the executive. The project manager then assesses how the Health and Safety Training Project will be delivered, including what products should be delivered in each stage.
Is this an appropriate way to carry out the 'plan the initiation stage' activity, and why?

choices.A: Yes, because the work of the initiation stage needs to be planned and approved, in the same way as other project work.
choices.B: Yes, because the management controls for the initiation stage need to be defined and approved by the project board.
choices.C: No, because subsequent stages are planned in the initiation stage as part of creating the project plan.
choices.D: No, because the senior supplier is responsible for assessing the viability of the project approach.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Agree with answer C.

Selected Answer: C
No, because subsequent stages are planned in the initiation stage as part of creating the project plan.

C. No, because subsequent stages are planned in the initiation stage as part of creating the project plan.

The statement in the scenario indicates that the project manager is assessing how the Health and Safety Training Project will be delivered, including what products should be delivered in each stage during the "starting up a project" process. This approach is not appropriate because the "starting up a project" process is primarily focused on the pre-project activities necessary to prepare for the initiation stage.

Selected Answer: C
The products to be delivered in each stage are only understood and plan in the Initiating a Project process (specifically during the "Create the Project Plan" activity).

Selected Answer: A
A is correct because you have to have a stage plan for initiating a project

choices.D: Update the stage plan to show the work package as completed.
choices.C: Verify that all the products to be delivered by the work package are approved.
choices.B: Check the work package and follow the procedure to deliver completed products.
choices.A: Update the team plan to show that the work package is complete.

discussion.content: In PRINCE2, the role of project assurance includes ensuring that the products produced by the work packages are of the required quality and meet the defined criteria for approval. Therefore, when the team manager reports that the work to update the 'corporate quality procedures' has been completed and the product is ready to be delivered, the project assurance should verify that all the products to be delivered by the work package have been reviewed and approved before they are formally accepted and used in the project.

questions.question_text:
During stage 3, the team manager reports that the work to update the 'corporate quality procedures' has been completed and the product is ready to be delivered.
What should project assurance do next?

DRAG DROP -

INITIATING A PROJECT -
Here are three items of information relating to the 'initiating a project' process for the project.
As part of which activity (A-F) should this information be recorded?
Choose only one theme for each activity. Each theme can be used once, more than once, or not at all.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
1 is Refine BC (even if, as per syllabus of 6th ed. activity name is Prepare Benefits Management Approach)
2 is Change Control Approach
3 is Communication Management Approach
